content.description: Climb the steep gully formed where the ridge going north broadens.  The crux in the gully section is getting stood up on the projecting rock piece where the angle steepens.  Soon move left onto the ridge face for pitch 2 and work your way to ridge.  Once on the ridge I preferred staying roped up going to the rap bolts towards the south end of this ridge .  A spectacular view and feeling along this narrow strangely shattered pressure ridge, but good solid rock.
content.protection: If you can do a little fist and hand crack with no pro you need only small and med friends.
content.location: Route starts on east face of ridge in steep gully where the ridge suddenly broadens.

content.description: Climb the crack in the corner to near the saddle and then traverse left on the steep face & crack to the left side of the face of the pinnacle.  Anchor bolts here.
content.protection: Some 3-4 friends with more in med range.
content.location: Begin on the conrner of the NE face of the Friend Pinnacle where that face meets the ridge face to the north.

content.description: Mostly face and crack on prow/arete of the end of the ridge.
content.protection: Bolt anchors but will need some small& med stopper and friend
content.location: Begin ridge that is NE across the talus field from Friend Pinnacle

content.description: A classic short route in a corner with only a few good holds
content.location: On the east face of the ridge north of the pinnacle.

content.description: Intermittant crack and face to an alcove and some figuring to set up for the last bulge.
content.protection: mosly medium gear with some bolts.
content.location: Clock wise from the Friendly Route to the west side of the saddle that is between the pinnacle and ridge.

content.description: From the saddle of traverse right to the summit boulder of Friend Pinnacle and climb the bulging-overhanging finger crack & face.
content.protection: maybe one bolt? with small nut and cams.
content.location: Began at saddle between Pinnacle and north ridge.

content.description: A steep parallel hand crack angle right and then strainght to a ledge with bolts anchors.
content.protection: For this pitch some hand sized friends.
content.location: Lower half of NE face of Friend Pinnacle

content.description: From a ledge on the east face of the ridge begin the crack at the left set of bolts.  The crux is the getting thru the pinched out seam and back on to easier crack with one bolt along here for pro.  The crack above is an easy cruise.
content.location: Route is on mid way ledge on east face of ridge just north of pinnacle.

content.description:
1.  A short jumper pitch over the block pile will get you to some belay bolts in the corner.

2.  Start in the corner but soon move right to the now opened crack and continue to the saddle between the pinnacle and the ridge to the north.

3. From the saddle traverse right on easy ledges until below the south face of the summit block.  Some gully like cracks lead to any easy finish.

Rappel bolt are on the NE corner.  A second set of "mid way" rap bolts is at the flake on the NE side of the pinnacle.
content.protection: Friends!!   Small and medium sized friends and stopper will make for a friendly climb.
content.location: The route is on the North side of the pinnacle where it leans onto the ridge.

content.description: The right angling crack pinches quite narrowly but affords small nuts for a short distance.
content.protection: small nuts with some small and med cams
content.location: East face of ridge that rises northward from pinnacle.
